examples: Aren't you pleased to see me?
And didn't he just sound pleased as punch about that?
The artist didn't have any particular outcome in mind when she started painting, but was pleased with the final result.
It was safe to say I was pleased to see the back of it!
The artist was pleased when her painting sold for a high price at the gallery.
words.defineEn: feeling happy and satisfied with something that has happened or with someone's actions
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc và hài lòng với điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc với hành động của ai đó

examples: Their daughter is as clever as they come.
This guy is either very clever or he's not playing with a full deck.
The clever student caught the teacher napping and managed to sneak out of class unnoticed.
In negotiations, a clever hawk hides its claws, which is why it's important to be strategic and hold back some of your bargaining chips until the right moment.
The film doesn't reinvent the wheel for action films, but it adds enough clever twists on the genre to still feel fresh and new.
words.defineEn: able to think quickly and find solutions to problems
words.defineVi: có thể suy nghĩ nhanh chóng và tìm giải pháp cho các vấn đề

examples: I couldn't help notice how pretty and intelligent she was and we just clicked.
Other intelligent animals experience grief in similar ways.
Are they intelligent?
What would intelligent life look like?
You're very intelligent.
words.defineEn: having or showing a high level of intelligence; good at learning things, understanding ideas, and thinking clearly
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện mức độ thông minh cao; giỏi học hỏi mọi thứ, hiểu ý tưởng và suy nghĩ rõ ràng

examples: Joe Biden also had a role model: Irish, Catholic, good-looking.
I think this is one of the best-looking SUVs available right now, but there is a Range Rover that is pretty good-looking as well.
words.defineEn: someone who has an attractive and pleasing appearance
words.defineVi: một người có vẻ ngoài hấp dẫn và dễ chịu

examples: To go crazy/mad/nuts/insane.
It’s crazy to make these changes without involving the students.
Her infectious laughter and radiant smile made him crazy.
It drives me crazy seeing all these people just staring at their phones all day long.
Would you stop shouting, you're driving me crazy!
words.defineEn: behaving in a very strange or unusual way
words.defineVi: cư xử theo một cách rất kỳ lạ hoặc bất thường

examples: I'm glad we can put this behind us.
We're glad to have you as part of our team.
I'm glad you read the riot act to Billy.
I felt glad to be back in harness.
I'm glad she's finally using her loaf.
words.defineEn: feeling happy or pleased
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc hoặc hài lòng

examples: Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
A large crowd watched the game on Saturday.
He left a large estate.
A large bus was sitting outside.
The truck delivered a large shipment of goods to the warehouse.
words.defineEn: big or above average in amount or size
words.defineVi: lớn hoặc trên trung bình về số lượng hoặc kích thước

examples: She said an awful lot
The incident says an awful lot about his character.
It's awful having a boss who breathes down your neck all the time.
I told you that you'd feel awful if you drank that much wine.
He couldn't help but grimace when he saw the awful outfit his friend was wearing.
words.defineEn: extremely unpleasant, bad, or disagreeable
words.defineVi: cực kỳ khó chịu, xấu, hoặc khó chịu

words.defineEn: having gained great fame or recognition
words.defineVi: đã đạt được danh tiếng lớn hoặc sự công nhận

examples: Everything appeared normal at first.
I tried to lead as normal a life as possible.
She may seem normal at first, but you'll realize she has many screws loose once you hear her conspiracy theories.
As every normal human being knows, one shouldn't throw good money after bad.
When people are in their right minds, they make reasoned decisions and act in a normal, understandable way.
words.defineEn: usual, ordinary, and in the same way we expect
words.defineVi: thông thường, thông thường, và theo cùng một cách chúng ta mong đợi

examples: The movie was as boring as they come.
It’s so boring, eating the same food day in, day out.
I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.
The child nodded off to sleep during the boring lecture.
This course seemed right up my alley when I signed up for it, but it ended up being dreadfully boring.
words.defineEn: making us feel tired and unsatisfied because of not being interesting
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy mệt mỏi và không hài lòng vì không thú vị

examples: We ate dinner in a noisy café.
The teacher took the student out of the noisy classroom to have a private conversation.
The party was ruined by a couple of noisy, rude gate-crashers.
Despite his wealth and fame, he often feels outside noisy, inside empty, longing for something more meaningful in his life.
We are so noisy!
words.defineEn: making or having of a lot of unwanted sounds
words.defineVi: tạo ra hoặc có nhiều âm thanh không mong muốn

examples: They had called her rude names.
I was piqued by his rude remark.
One of my colleagues was rude to me in a meeting, and I was tempted to snap back.
He made a rude remark, but I let it ride.
Being rude to me won't get you anywhere.
words.defineEn: having no respect for other people
words.defineVi: không tôn trọng người khác

examples: Stupid is as stupid does.
Stupid is as stupid does.
You're always pushing it and you take stupid risks!
No bashing your stupid head against a wall is ever gonna change that.
My wedding was supposed to be my special day, but my sister and her stupid boyfriend took the stage when he proposed to her at the wedding reception.
words.defineEn: not having common sense or the ability to understand or learn quickly
words.defineVi: không có ý thức chung hoặc khả năng hiểu hoặc học hỏi nhanh chóng

examples: She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
He wore dirty shoes that left muddy footprints on the floor.
The dirty dishes in the restaurant's kitchen needed to be washed.
He had a dirty face after playing in the mud.
words.defineEn: having stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: có vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: Ron's personal life is as miserable as sin.
Oh, I'm miserable.
He is generally miserable and never gets on top of his work.
To lead a life of luxury/a miserable existence.
Everyone just stood around looking miserable as sin during the ceremony.
words.defineEn: feeling very unhappy or uncomfortable
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất không vui hoặc không thoải mái

examples: The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
The slow healing process of the wound required regular care.
The slow elevator took a long time to reach the desired floor.
Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
She had a slow learning pace but never gave up.
words.defineEn: moving, happening, or being done at a speed that is low
words.defineVi: di chuyển, xảy ra hoặc được thực hiện ở tốc độ thấp

examples: He feels the cold a lot.
The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
Sarah’s got a cold.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
He's out cold and as still as a stone.
words.defineEn: having a temperature lower than the human body's average temperature
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ thấp hơn nhiệt độ trung bình của cơ thể con người

examples: Ancient is not a synonym for stupid.
And it evidences itself with liberty becoming a synonym for selfishness.
Over time, the two merged to give us the English we know today, though the divide between lords and peasants can still be felt in synonym pairs such as cow and beef.

Next time someone says that they don't like it when there are chemicals in their food, please remind them that all life is made of chemicals and would they please stop pretending that the word chemical is somehow a synonym for carcinogen!
They help you save time and make your writing more compelling by finding synonyms for overused words and completely removing unnecessary words.
words.defineEn: a word or phrase that has the same or nearly the same meaning as another word or phrase in the same language
words.defineVi: một từ hoặc cụm từ có cùng nghĩa hoặc gần giống với một từ hoặc cụm từ khác trong cùng một ngôn ngữ

words.defineEn: a word or phrase that has an opposite or contrasting meaning to another word or phrase
words.defineVi: một từ hoặc cụm từ có nghĩa đối lập hoặc tương phản với một từ hoặc cụm từ khác

examples: Don't be scared to speak to him.
He watched a scary movie and got scared during the suspenseful scenes.
I was really scared when I encountered a bear in the wilderness.
You've got your rivals running scared.
The young boy was scared of the rocking boat at first, but his grandfather helped him find his sea legs and they spent the day fishing together.
words.defineEn: afraid of something or someone
words.defineVi: sợ một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: As frightened as I am to die, I'm also curious to know what it's like beyond the veil.
The villagers are very frightened of his ghost.
Mr Edgar looked very frightened.
I was kind of frightened.
I was definitely frightened.
words.defineEn: feeling afraid or anxious
words.defineVi: cảm thấy sợ hãi hoặc lo lắng

examples: Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
That extension is busy right now.
I want a dish of creamy mushroom bucatini with Parmesan right now.
Right by holding the candle to the devil.
After the traffic lights, turn right.
words.defineEn: based on facts or the truth
words.defineVi: dựa trên sự thật hoặc sự thật

examples: The teacher corrected my mistake and explained the correct solution.
She gave a correct response to the teacher's question.
His correct pronunciation impressed everyone in the language class.
The teacher highlighted the correct steps to solve the math problem.
After numerous inspections, the correct answer to this dilemma still remains at sea.
words.defineEn: based on the truth and without mistakes
words.defineVi: dựa trên sự thật và không có sai lầm

examples: Rugby and art seem strange bedfellows.
The dishwasher is making a strange noise.
He holds strange views on education.
It felt strange to be back in my old school.
The society's preoccupation with safety and stranger danger is just unbelievable.
words.defineEn: having unusual, unexpected, or confusing qualities
words.defineVi: có phẩm chất bất thường, bất ngờ hoặc khó hiểu

examples: When Sarah's friends teased her about her unusual tastes in music and art, she reminded them that every Jack has his Jill, and she would eventually find someone who appreciated her interests.
The person may have unusual mannerisms.
Lamborghini situation is not unusual.
Kathy's situation is not unusual.
Was that unusual?
words.defineEn: not commonly happening or done
words.defineVi: không thường xảy ra hoặc thực hiện

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of skill or effort to do
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm

examples: The separation from Julie was already difficult for Alex.
The boss always assigns difficult projects as a way of kicking the tires of new employees.
You've given yourselves a difficult task.
It may be too difficult for the trainee - small dog, tall weeds!
It’s difficult to do housework with the children under my feet all the time.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of work or skill to do, understand, or deal with
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều công việc hoặc kỹ năng để làm, hiểu hoặc giải quyết

examples: I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
words.defineEn: emotionally feeling good
words.defineVi: cảm xúc tốt

examples: She adores her little alligator pouch.
I absolutely adore these two bowties!
I adore him.
I just adore to work.
and I just have adored every second of this journey.
words.defineEn: to love and respect someone very much
words.defineVi: yêu và tôn trọng ai đó rất nhiều

examples: There's a lovely park right on our doorstep.
She was a lovely woman and my mother truly enjoyed her company.
I have been as busy as a beaver these last few weeks crocheting up custom orders for some lovely customers.
They’ve let that lovely old house fall to pieces around them.
The rose was pink and had a lovely scent.
words.defineEn: very beautiful or attractive
words.defineVi: rất đẹp hoặc hấp dẫn

examples: Your presentation sounded great, honestly.
The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
To show great courage.
The pope himself had taken great umbrage at the book.
The baby has brought them great joy.
words.defineEn: worthy of being approved or admired
words.defineVi: xứng đáng được chấp thuận hoặc ngưỡng mộ

examples: Terrified people streamed from homes and offices.
First of all, I'm terrified because I'm this close to a corpse.
Yeah, I'd be so terrified to ever do stand-up.
Maybe you feel as terrified as the characters hiding from a serial killer, which just kinda sucks.
But I'm terrified to clip them because he's a fidgety, movey guy Right.
words.defineEn: feeling extremely scared and afraid
words.defineVi: cảm thấy vô cùng sợ hãi và sợ hãi

examples: The old lady's cake wasn't wonderful
Doesn’t Rosie look wonderful?
Squash adds a wonderful texture and sweetness to curries.
Since the news broke I've received thousands of wonderful letters.
To my eye, Jake, you're the most wonderful man on the planet.
words.defineEn: very great and pleasant
words.defineVi: rất tuyệt vời và dễ chịu

examples: My friend is afraid he might go down with the flu.
I’m afraid I’ll have to pass on that offer of coffee.
I'm afraid I have to disagree with your interpretation of the data.
I was afraid he was going to hit me.
I'm afraid I'm a bad dancer.
words.defineEn: getting a bad and anxious feeling from a person or thing because we think something bad or dangerous will happen
words.defineVi: nhận được một cảm giác tồi tệ và lo lắng từ một người hoặc một vật bởi vì chúng tôi nghĩ điều gì đó tồi tệ hoặc nguy hiểm sẽ xảy ra

examples: The paneer curry smells amazing!
It’s amazing.
My mom is an amazing cook.
It is amazing really.
That's amazing Ralph.
words.defineEn: extremely surprising, particularly in a good way
words.defineVi: cực kỳ ngạc nhiên, đặc biệt là trong một cách tốt

examples: After all, love will find a way.
He loved gardening.
They loved the sun-dried tomato and mozzarella-filled pansotti.
I love the vibrant green color of Granny Smith apples.
I love the crunch of romaine lettuce in my sandwiches.
words.defineEn: to have very strong feelings for someone or something that is important to us and we like a lot and want to take care of
words.defineVi: có tình cảm rất mãnh liệt với ai đó hoặc điều gì đó quan trọng đối với chúng ta và chúng ta rất thích và muốn chăm sóc

examples: The purple flowers in the vase were beautiful.
My mom planted beautiful flowers in the front yard.
It's beautiful!
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
The vibrant purple color of whinberries adds a beautiful touch to desserts like cheesecakes and tarts.
words.defineEn: extremely pleasing to the mind or senses
words.defineVi: cực kỳ dễ chịu cho tâm trí hoặc các giác quan

examples: The museum is a fascinating place to learn about history and art.
The monkey's intelligence and adaptability made it a fascinating creature to study.
I find it fascinating to learn about the wonders of the natural world through science.
This meeting was fascinating.
Today's question is fascinating.
words.defineEn: extremely interesting or captivating
words.defineVi: cực kỳ thú vị hoặc quyến rũ

examples: My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
My vegetarian friend enjoyed a nourishing adzuki bean grain bowl for lunch.
The hiker enjoyed the scenic beauty of the river's gentle bends.
words.defineEn: to take pleasure or find happiness in something or someone
words.defineVi: để có niềm vui hoặc tìm thấy hạnh phúc trong một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

words.defineEn: (of a photograph or video) appearing blurry or unclear, often due to incorrect camera settings or improper focusing
words.defineVi: (của ảnh hoặc video) bị mờ hoặc không rõ ràng, thường là do cài đặt máy ảnh không chính xác hoặc lấy nét không đúng cách

examples: "That boy isn't very bright."
These shrubs produce bright red berries.
The bird had bright feathers and a long beak.
Some bright spark left the tap running all night.
I arrived bright and early at Brian the falconer's house for day one of my course.
words.defineEn: (of weather) sunny and without many clouds
words.defineVi: (về thời tiết) nắng và không có nhiều mây

examples: The car ahead of me jumped the light.
The lights changed to green.
Sometimes darkness can show you the light.
A major technological advancement like that is still light years away.
This software first saw the light of day back in 1993.
words.defineEn: having less amount of color; not dark
words.defineVi: có ít màu hơn; không tối

examples: The coffee in the mug was a dark.
The coffee table was a dark wood color.
Her dark hair was tied back in a ponytail.
The unique flavor of physalis pairs wonderfully with dark chocolate in desserts.
The dark clouds signaled that rain was on its way.
words.defineEn: not light in color
words.defineVi: không sáng màu

examples: The garden looks nice.
The soft carpet feels nice under my feet.
The children were nice as pie.
This room would make a nice office.
The spicy sausage and mushroom fusilli had a nice kick of flavor.
words.defineEn: providing pleasure and enjoyment
words.defineVi: cung cấp niềm vui và hưởng thụ

examples: She said an awful lot
The incident says an awful lot about his character.
It's awful having a boss who breathes down your neck all the time.
I told you that you'd feel awful if you drank that much wine.
He couldn't help but grimace when he saw the awful outfit his friend was wearing.
words.defineEn: extremely unpleasant, bad, or disagreeable
words.defineVi: cực kỳ khó chịu, xấu, hoặc khó chịu
